alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 2:09PM MST until December 26 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches. Locally higher amounts are possible, particularly across the Logan area mountains and areas favored in southwesterly flow such as Provo Canyon. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 8 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible particularly late tonight through Sunday morning. Winter driving conditions can be expected, along with potential traction restrictions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas favored in southwesterly flow will see moderate to heavy snow late this evening through tonight. A fast moving band of very heavy snow will cross the area early Sunday morning, bringing snowfall rates in excess of 2 inches an hour.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
